de.ralleytn.wrapper.microsoft.xinput

Class XInputKeystroke

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sun.jna.Structure
      • de.ralleytn.wrapper.microsoft.xinput.XInputKeystroke

  • public final class XInputKeystroke
extends com.sun.jna.Structure
    Specifies keystroke data returned by XInput.XInputGetKeystroke(int, int, XInputKeystroke).

    Remarks

    Future devices may return HID codes and virtual key values that are not supported on current devices, and are currently undefined. Applications should ignore these unexpected values. A virtual-key code is a byte value that represents a particular physical key on the keyboard, not the character or characters (possibly none) that the key can be mapped to based on keyboard state. The keyboard state at the time a virtual key is pressed modifies the character reported. For example, VK_4 might represent a "4" or a "$", depending on the state of the SHIFT key. A reported keyboard event includes the virtual key that caused the event, whether the key was pressed or released (or is repeating), and the state of the keyboard at the time of the event. The keyboard state includes information about whether any CTRL, ALT, or SHIFT keys are down. If the keyboard event represents an Unicode character (for example, pressing the "A" key), the Unicode member will contain that character. Otherwise, Unicode will contain the value zero. The valid virtual-key (VK_xxx) codes are defined in XInput.h. In addition to codes that indicate key presses, the following codes indicate controller input.

    ValueDescription
    XInput.VK_PAD_A}A button
    XInput.VK_PAD_B}B button
    XInput.VK_PAD_X}X button
    XInput.VK_PAD_Y}Y button
    XInput.VK_PAD_RSHOULDER}Right shoulder button
    XInput.VK_PAD_LSHOULDER}Left shoulder button
    XInput.VK_PAD_LTRIGGER}Left trigger
    XInput.VK_PAD_RTRIGGER}Right trigger
    XInput.VK_PAD_DPAD_UP}Directional pad up
    XInput.VK_PAD_DPAD_DOWN}Directional pad down
    XInput.VK_PAD_DPAD_LEFT}Directional pad left
    XInput.VK_PAD_DPAD_RIGHT}Directional pad right
    XInput.VK_PAD_START}START button
    XInput.VK_PAD_BACK}BACK button
    XInput.VK_PAD_LTHUMB_PRESS}Left thumbstick click
    XInput.VK_PAD_RTHUMB_PRESS}Right thumbstick click
    XInput.VK_PAD_LTHUMB_UP}Left thumbstick up
    XInput.VK_PAD_LTHUMB_DOWN}Left thumbstick down
    XInput.VK_PAD_LTHUMB_RIGHT}Left thumbstick right
    XInput.VK_PAD_LTHUMB_LEFT}Left thumbstick left
    XInput.VK_PAD_LTHUMB_UPLEFT}Left thumbstick up and left
    XInput.VK_PAD_LTHUMB_UPRIGHT}Left thumbstick up and right
    XInput.VK_PAD_LTHUMB_DOWNRIGHT}Left thumbstick down and right
    XInput.VK_PAD_LTHUMB_DOWNLEFT}Left thumbstick down and left
    XInput.VK_PAD_RTHUMB_UP}Right thumbstick up
    XInput.VK_PAD_RTHUMB_DOWN}Right thumbstick down
    XInput.VK_PAD_RTHUMB_RIGHT}Right thumbstick right
    XInput.VK_PAD_RTHUMB_LEFT}Right thumbstick left
    XInput.VK_PAD_RTHUMB_UPLEFT}Right thumbstick up and left
    XInput.VK_PAD_RTHUMB_UPRIGHT}Right thumbstick up and right
    XInput.VK_PAD_RTHUMB_DOWNRIGHT}Right thumbstick down and right
    XInput.VK_PAD_RTHUMB_DOWNLEFT}Right thumbstick down and left

    • Field Detail

      • VirtualKey

        public short VirtualKey
        Virtual-key code of the key, button, or stick movement. See XInput.h for a list of valid virtual-key (VK_xxx) codes. Also, see Remarks.

        Source: Microsoft Documentation

        Since:
        1.0.0

      • Unicode

        public java.lang.String Unicode
        This member is unused and the value is zero.

        Source: Microsoft Documentation

        Since:
        1.0.0

      • Flags

        public short Flags

        Flags that indicate the keyboard state at the time of the input event. This member can be any combination of the following flags:

        ValueDescription
        XInput.XINPUT_KEYSTROKE_KEYDOWN}The key was pressed.
        XInput.XINPUT_KEYSTROKE_KEYUP}The key was released.
        XInput.XINPUT_KEYSTROKE_REPEAT}A repeat of a held key.

        Source: Microsoft Documentation

        Since:
        1.0.0

      • UserIndex

        public byte UserIndex
        Index of the signed-in gamer associated with the device. Can be a value in the range 0 – 3.

        Source: Microsoft Documentation

        Since:
        1.0.0

      • HidCode

        public byte HidCode
        HID code corresponding to the input. If there is no corresponding HID code, this value is zero.

        Source: Microsoft Documentation

        Since:
        1.0.0
